alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:26PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving thunderstorm will impact portions of central Durham County through 830 PM EDT... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a slow moving thunderstorm near Butner, or 8 miles northeast of Durham, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain may lead to isolated flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Durham, Gorman and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
